contentrichtext.text: {{primarysources|date=December 2009}} The '''Worshipful Company of Glovers''' is one of the [[Livery Company|Livery Companies]] of the [[City of London]]. Glovers were originally classified as [[Worshipful Company of Cordwainers|Cordwainers]], but eventually separated to form their own organization in 1349. They received a [[Royal Charter]] of incorporation in 1639. The Company is now, as are most other Livery Companies, a charitable body, instead of a body that retains links to its original trade. A ceremonial link, though, is still maintained; the Company formally presents the [[Monarch of the United Kingdom|Sovereign]] with gloves upon his or her coronation. The Company ranks sixty-second in the [[order of precedence]] of Livery Companies. The Company's motto is ''True Hearts and Warm Hands''. ==External links== * [http://www.thegloverscompany.org/ Official website] {{Livery Companies in the City of London}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Worshipful Company Of Glovers}} [[Category:Livery companies|Glovers]] [[Category:Organisations based in London with royal patronage]] [[Category:1349 establishments in England]] {{London-stub}} {{UK-org-stub}}
